intro: Ammocharis tinneana, commonly known as the Cape bell orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces white or pale pink blooms that are often fragrant, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. The bulbs of Ammocharis tinneana are adapted to store water, allowing the plant to survive in arid conditions.
